meanings.definition: A valley or hollow, typically between two hills or mountains.
meanings.sent1: The hikers explored the peaceful vales surrounded by tall mountains.
meanings.sent2: The vales were filled with colorful flowers and chirping birds.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the vales held a secret meeting to discuss the upcoming picnic.
meanings.sent4: The vales whispered ancient stories to those who listened carefully.
meanings.sent5: The vales cradled the sleepy village in their protective embrace.

meanings.definition: Third person singular present of 'vale', meaning to bid farewell.
meanings.sent1: She vales her friends warmly before they depart on their journey.
meanings.sent2: He vales his family every morning before heading off to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat vales the mouse before letting it go free in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The old tree vales its leaves as autumn arrives, preparing for winter.
meanings.sent5: The kind teacher vales each student at the end of the school year.
